description:
Aaosphaeria arxii CBS 175.79 is a species of fungus that belongs to the ascomycete family Aaosphaeriaceae. It is a filamentous, hyphomycetous fungus that was first isolated from soil collected in the Netherlands.

The fungus produces dark-colored, septate hyphae that can form dense mycelial mats. Its conidiophores are erect, branched, and bear chains of pigmented, ellipsoidal to fusiform conidia. The conidia are typically 10-15 μm in length and 4-6 μm in width.

Aaosphaeria arxii is known to be a saprophytic fungus, meaning it derives its nutrients from decaying organic matter in the environment. It has been studied for its potential biotechnological applications, such as the production of enzymes or secondary metabolites.

The strain CBS 175.79 refers to the culture collection number assigned to this particular isolate of Aaosphaeria arxii by the Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures (CBS) in the Netherlands.
